intro: Adenandra muraltioides, commonly known as the golden bush, is a shrub native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, yellow flowers. The plant produces small, spherical fruits that are typically red or orange when mature. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and as a hedge plant.
